content.question: What changes could local governments, businesses, and corporations make to reverse Japan’s national birth patterns?

choices.label: Decreasing transportation costs to allow workers to commute from locations farther outside of densely populated urban centers
Adding low-cost or zero-cost infant daycare and preschool centers to make larger family sizes more affordable
Reducing the length of maternity leave to incentivize women to return to paid employment
Enforcing a strict antinatalist policy that provides incentives for families to have fewer children
Increasing access to family planning clinics and making doctor’s office visits free for women patients

content.answer: Adding low-cost or zero-cost infant daycare and preschool centers to make larger family sizes more affordable
